name: Chipotle Ranch Dip
author: *Sherri*
summary: I came up with a very quick, easy lower-in-fat dip or sauce to make with those leftover chipotle peppers. This dip combines the smoky chipotle with the great seasoning of ranch dressing mix. Makes a great veggie dip, or even a topping on hamburgers or Mexican foods. Chipotle peppers are very spicy; start with one and taste. Removing seeds will tone down the heat. I usually use 2 with seeds. You can also substitute low-fat Greek yogurt in place of the sour cream.
ingredients: 2 ½ tablespoons dry ranch dressing mix
1  canned chipotle chile in adobo sauce, minced, or more to taste
directions: Whisk the mayonnaise, sour cream, ranch dressing mix, green onions, garlic, lime juice, and chipotle chile together in a bowl until blended
Serve immediately, or refrigerate until needed
